# Links and URLs

## Standard Markdown Links

Here's a [simple link](https://example.com) in text.

Multiple links: [Google](https://google.com) and [GitHub](https://github.com).

[Link with spaces in text](https://example.com/path)

[Link with **bold** text](https://example.com)

## Plain URLs (Auto-Link)

Visit https://example.com for more info.

Check out https://github.com/user/repo for the code.

Multiple URLs: https://one.com and https://two.com in same line.

URL at end of sentence: https://example.com.

URL with path: https://example.com/path/to/resource?query=value&other=123

## Edge Cases

Link to file: [local file](file:///path/to/file.txt)

Email style: [email](mailto:user@example.com)

Links with parentheses: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Test_(disambiguation))

## Links In Lists

- [First link](https://one.com)
- [Second link](https://two.com)
  - [Nested link](https://nested.com)
